snippet: Shatterproof glass used to separate inmates at the District of Columbia jail from the visitors sitting across from them. Now, they sit in separate buildings, at computers equipped with Web cameras, Adeshina Emmanuel reports on Tuesday in The New York...
abstract: Shatterproof glass used to separate inmates at the District of Columbia jail from the visitors sitting across from them. Now, they sit in separate buildings, at computers equipped with Web cameras, Adeshina Emmanuel reports on Tuesday in The New York Times.

headline.main: Daily Report: When Video Links Replace In-Person Jail Visits
